intro: Racosperma torulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow floral spikes. The plant has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Racosperma torulosum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and animals.
